title: Client Crashes and Lobbies
body:
Something that occurs quite often is a client crash, it stops working, responding, doing anything, most of the time it's harmless, but it can be aggravating. Just today I've dropped 15 lp, I haven't lost a match, or dodged a game, my client has crashed twice though in a ranked lobby, I currently have a 30 minute leavebuster for no real reason other than Riot felt like this. I'm expressing my concern not only for how common the crashes are but how we're punished, lack of good support means we can't really tell anyone but the forums about it. And it really blows my mind that they haven't implemented a way to join a lobby back after a change, if I'm the 5th person to lock in and it crashes after bans I should be able to join the lobby back cause my friends are still in it, but no, we have to wait for everyone to log in, for it to get to me, and for it to countdown, then we have to wait out the leavebuster and try to make up in lp. It's frustrating, it's wasting my time, and it's causing me to derank.
 {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

replies.body:
Disconnections, crashes, or delays in champ select often happen where there is a poor or unstable connection to the server. While there are a ton of potential causes, our [connection troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) will take you through the most common solutions.

If you still see issues, let me know.

>
> Disconnections, crashes, or delays in champ select often happen where there is a poor or unstable connection to the server. While there are a ton of potential causes, our [connection troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) will take you through the most common solutions.
> 
> If you still see issues, let me know.

I don't think it's a connection problem. A lot of people have been getting client crashes lately. I think it's related to memory usage getting extremely high and then the client stops responding.
Most of the client crashes are a result of poor connectivity, corrupt game files, out of date operating systems and such.

> [{quoted}](name=Rineyy,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9HgaeZFF,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-01T03:10:07.046+0000)
>
> Most of the client crashes are a result of poor connectivity, corrupt game files, out of date operating systems and such.

Not recently. This has been happening to pretty much everyone on my friends-list lately, and it has had nothing to do with internet problems.

It depends on the specifics of the crash.

1. When did it happen?
2. Did they receive an error message / bug splat?
3. Is a reoccurring issue?

> [{quoted}](name=Rineyy,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9HgaeZFF,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-01T04:13:06.595+0000)
>
> It depends on the specifics of the crash.
> 
> 1. When did it happen?
> 2. Did they receive an error message / bug splat?
> 3. Is a reoccurring issue?

1.) almost exclusively in champ select 
2.) No
3.) yes

The primary cause of disconnects in champ select without receiving a bug splat / error message is an unstable connection to the game servers.

Champ Select in all modes requires a consistently stable connection. If a stable connection isn't established, they will disconnect without receiving an error message. 

They'll need to perform the steps listed in the article linked by Targons Blade. If they perform all of the steps and still experience issues, let them get back to us.

> [{quoted}](name=Rineyy,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=9HgaeZFF,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-01T05:45:43.112+0000)
>
> The primary cause of disconnects in champ select without receiving a bug splat / error message is an unstable connection to the game servers.
> 
> Champ Select in all modes requires a consistently stable connection. If a stable connection isn't established, they will disconnect without receiving an error message. 
> 
> They'll need to perform the steps listed in the article linked by Targons Blade. If they perform all of the steps and still experience issues, let them get back to us.

The thing is, what I am talking about (and the OP as well) is not disconnects. The client literally freezes because it's sucking up too much memory and forces you to close and re-open it. There's no internet problem related to it.

What's the memory usage % when they're in champ select? Champ Select, in all modes uses more memory than just having the client idle. Likewise with the Hextech Crafting Hub and to some extent, the Store. It's unlikely that it's related to the disconnects but let us know the %.
